core:processNote.core:description: The SellItem prompt is necessary only to get round an existing bug. The bug is that the after the first ProductButtonPressed event is fired when we return to the ProductButtonGrid prompt the ProductButtonPressed is not fired again. This is because the panel on the prompt is not correctly being re-enabled. To get round this bug we have added a SellItem state which causes the State to change and then the Prompt items to be reenabled when we go back to the ProductButtonGrid prompt.

In order to refresh the ButtonPanel on the ProductButtonGridPanel when the user hits Next/Previous we have to create an entirely new State and then close the ProductButtonGrid prompt. Without this, buttons from the previous page hang around on the next (if there are blank spaces for them).

If the menu item has been configured with event "SellFromProductList" but the useButtons is not set or is false then we revert to the list format (as opposed to buttons), which functions on all themes (the new Product List using buttons and receipt display only displays correctly on NextGen themes currently).

If the GroupTypeId is ‘region’ then we do not set the variant elements of the GroupTypeKey, because the variant is *always* used to set the region, except when the group type is ‘region’ in which case it is emtpy.
As the keyboard is never required on the Product List screen it is hidden. The user has to reenable manually if they want it on return to the Sale screen
